cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles SSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, forecast to turn northeast on Monday and then east on Tuesday, pulling away from the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: brushes the Outer Banks, North Carolina (no significant inland landfall expected)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City to Duck, NC including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Surf City to Duck, NC including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coastline from Georgia through North Carolina, with swell and rip-current risk as far north as New Jersey
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤7%) of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; otherwise breezy conditions 15–25 kt with higher gusts during Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Delaware River; only minor tide anomalies possible with persistent onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may bring 1–2 inches of rain to the Philadelphia area late Monday night through Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and long-period swells will increase wave heights and create strong rip currents, posing a navigational challenge for vessels entering or leaving Delaware Bay.
